greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts 8k+6 and 8k+7 with at least one part of each type.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: nmax = 83; s1 = Range[0, nmax/8]*8 + 6; s2 = Range[0, nmax/8]*8 + 7;
x_ /; ContainsAny[x, s1 ] && ContainsAny[x, s2 ]], {n, 1, nmax}] (* _Robert Price_, Aug 16 2020 *)
nmax = 83; l = Rest@CoefficientList[Series[(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(8 k + 6)), {k, 0, nmax}])*(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(8 k + 7)), {k, 0, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Robert Price_, Aug 16 2020*)
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
